pullRequest.title: DB-10110 Fix retrieving aliases of user-defined tables.

commit.message: DB-10110 Fix retrieving aliases of user-defined tables.
DB-10110 upgrade script for setting JavaClassName column.

nodes.bodyText: We need to check rowTemplate[I] == null here which has the fetched row content.

From DB-9388, I learnt that for rows in dictionary table, partial row update does not seem to work well. To be safe, we should read all the columns of the row, and also provide the complete update row for update. That is, set all the bits for both columnToReadSet and columnToUpdateSet.
It is better to populate all columns of the replaceRow.
Can you run the upgrade test with some alias/synonym created before the upgrade, and see if the rows in sys aliases are properly updated and can be queried?
Move this down with other column names for better readability
Shouldn't we use the check "rowTemplate[I] == null"? I think we only have problem when this field is not populated at all, and thus null. Do we have a problem if rowTemplate[I] has a NULL value?
this is a constructor, not a method...?
not really a constructor, should be with the other variables.
